notfound.heading: Sorry, an unexpected error has occurred

aside.subheader: Plug and play with your Edge devices and unify the data into standards compliant MQTT workload

password.label: Password
password.support: Contact your system administrator for access credentials

error.tokenInvalid: There is a problem with your credentials. Contact us
error.tokenExpired: Your credentials have expired. Contact us

welcome.title: Welcome to HiveMQ
welcome.description: Connect from and to any device and send streams of data to your enterprise.

readMore.title: Connect MQTT or MQTT-SN devices to the broker
readMore.label: Read more

protocolAdapter.title: Use HiveMQ Edge modular Protocol adapters to connect to local and network based devices.
protocolAdapter.label: Get Started!

connectEnterprise.header: From HiveMQ Edge to the Enterprise

bridge.title: Connect your HiveMQ Edge MQTT Broker to your Enterprise using MQTT Bridge connections.
bridge.label: Get Started!

bridge.title: MQTT bridges
bridge.description: A MQTT bridge lets you connect two MQTT brokers together. They are generally used for sharing messages between systems.

delete.title: Deleting Bridge
delete.description: We've successfully deleted the bridge for you.
delete.error: There was a problem trying to delete the bridge

update.title: Updating Bridge
update.description: We've successfully updated the bridge for you.
update.error: There was a problem trying to update the bridge

create.title: Creating Bridge
create.description: We've successfully created a new bridge for you.
create.error: There was a problem trying to create the bridge

local.info: Subscriptions to your local MQTT Broker are used to forward messages from this HiveMQ Edge to a remote MQTT broker.

remote.info: Subscriptions to a remote MQTT Broker are used to receive messages from a remote MQTT broker on this HiveMQ Edge.

filters.label: Filters
filters.helper: The list of topics used to filter the messages. MQTT wildcards are supported.

error.required: At least one topic is required

destination.label: Destination
destination.helper: The destination topic. You can use '{#}' to keep the original topic.

error.required: At least one topic is required

topic.placeholder: Type your topic and press enter...

id.label: Name
id.helper: The unique name of this bridge

error.required: The name of the bridge is required
error.pattern: Should only contain alpha-numeric characters with spaces and hyphens
error.notUnique: The name is already in use for another bridge

cleanStart.label: Clean Start
cleanStart.helper: Clean start determines if existing MQTT session state should be cleared up on connect.

loopPrevention.label: Enable loop prevention
loopPrevention.helper: Ensure messages cannot cause infinite loops.

hopCount.label: Maximum hop count for bridged messages
hopCount.helper: The maximum number of hops before a message is discarded.

keepAlive.label: Keep Alive
keepAlive.helper: Maximum time (in seconds) that the client maybe considered idle before disconnection

sessionExpiry.label: Session Expiry
sessionExpiry.helper: Time in seconds your session is maintained on the broker

clientid.label: Client Id Override
clientid.helper: Override the client identifier used to connect to the remote broker. Leave empty to use the bridge id.

cipherSuites.label: Cipher Suites
cipherSuites.helper: Select the cipher suites. Leave empty to use the default cipher suites.

enabled.label: Enable Transport Layer Security (TLS)
enabled.helper: If a TLS listener is enabled in HiveMQ, each client connection for that listener is encrypted and secured by TLS

protocols.label: TLS Protocols
protocols.helper: Select the protocols. Leave emtpy to use the default protocols.

noDataWarning.title: No bridges currently installed
noDataWarning.description: Configure Bridges to start sending data to your enterprise MQTT broker.

stepper.description: Create a new bridge to a broker

protocolAdapter.title: Protocol Adapters
protocolAdapter.description: Protocol adapters provide the ability to connect your HiveMQ Edge installation to local and remote devices. Once a connection has been established, you can consolidate data from this connection into your HiveMQ MQTT Broker.

noDataWarning.title: No protocol adapters are configured
noDataWarning.description: Protocol adapters allow you to connect your HiveMQ Edge installation to local or remote devices. View your installed protocol adapters to create new connections.

protocols.adapterCount_zero: There are no adapter protocol defined. Please check your configuration
protocols.description_zero: There are no adapter protocol defined. Please check your configuration
protocols.description_one: Select the adapter type to start creating your adapter
protocols.description_other: Select one of the following $t(protocolAdapter.protocols.adapterCount, {"count": {{count}} }) to start creating your adapter

delete.title: Deleting Protocol Adapter
delete.description: We've successfully deleted the Protocol Adapter for you.
delete.error: There was a problem trying to delete the Protocol Adapter

update.title: Updating Protocol Adapter
update.description: We've successfully updated the Protocol Adapter for you.
update.error: There was a problem trying to update the Protocol Adapter

create.title: Creating Protocol Adapter
create.description: We've successfully created a new Protocol Adapter for you.
create.error: There was a problem trying to create the Protocol Adapter

articles.title: Articles
articles.description: Some reading for your understanding of HiveMQ Edge

info.title: ISA-95 Unified Namespace
descriptions: A Unified Namespace is a middleware solution that allows you to collect data from various industrial systems, add context to it, and transform it into a format that other systems can understand.
ISA 95 provides a convenient way of structuring data sources in relation to their position within a manufacturing enterprise, hierarchically.
info.link: Go to hivemq website to know more

enabled.label: Enable Unified Namespace
enabled.helper: When enabled, unified namespace will provide tokens that can be used in topics to apply UNS convention to your data.

enterprise.label: Enterprise
enterprise.helper: Help text goes here to explain what it is

prefixAllTopics.label: Add prefix to all topics
prefixAllTopics.helper: MQTT topics will use the namespace defined

disabled.description: A unified namespace is no longer setup. All namespaces created remain the same but the standard will no longer be in use in this system.
